title: Live coverage: Firefly Aerospace attempts first Moon landing with Blue Ghost
summary: The robotic lander will attempt to touch down on the lunar surface at Mare Crisium near Mons Latreille Sunday morning. The anticipated landing time is no earlier than 3:34 a.m. EST (0834 UTC).

title: FAA gives approval for next Starship test flight
summary:
The FAA has given its approval for the next flight of SpaceX’s Starship even while the investigation into the failed previous flight continues.
The post FAA gives approval for next Starship test flight appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 21 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The mission comes a day after announcing they crossed 5 million subscribers to the Starlink internet service. Liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is set for 9:24 p.m. EST (0224 UTC).

title: Varda Space capsule lands in Australia with critical data for hypersonic vehicles
summary:
After spending six weeks in orbit, the capsule touched down at the Koonibba Test Range in South Australia
The post Varda Space capsule lands in Australia with critical data for hypersonic vehicles appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Sentinel-2A Given One-Year Exceptional and Temporary Extension
summary:
The European Space Agency has announced that the Sentinel-2A satellite has received a one-year extension, delaying its planned retirement. As part of the European Commission’s Copernicus programme, the Sentinel-2 mission delivers high-resolution optical imagery for land monitoring. This data supports agriculture, forestry, disaster response, and environmental protection by tracking changes in vegetation, soil, and water […]
The post Sentinel-2A Given One-Year Exceptional and Temporary Extension appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Smooshing for Science: A Flat-Out Success
summary: Written by Henry Manelski, Ph.D. student at Purdue University The Perseverance team is always looking for creative ways to use the tools we have on Mars to maximize the science we do. On the arm of the rover sits the SHERLOC instrument, which specializes in detecting organic compounds and is crucial in our search for […]

title: Two senators question Air Force nominee’s SpaceX connections
summary:
Sens. Elizabeth Warren (D-Mass.) and Tammy Duckworth (D-Ill.), both members of the Senate Armed Services Committee, sent a letter to Meink seeking clarity on his relationship with SpaceX and its chief executive, Elon Musk

title: NOAA Hit Hard by DOGE Layoffs
summary: NOAA is the latest federal agency hit hard by layoffs ordered by the White House’s Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) spearheaded by Elon Musk. The office that issues licenses to […]

title: NASA Uses New Technology to Understand California Wildfires
summary: The January wildfires in California devastated local habitats and communities. In an effort to better understand wildfire behavior, NASA scientists and engineers tried to learn from the events by testing new technology. The new instrument, the Compact Fire Infrared Radiance Spectral Tracker (c-FIRST), was tested when NASA’s B200 King Air aircraft flew over the wildfires […]

title: What’s Up: March 2025 Skywatching Tips from NASA
summary: A Fast-Moving Planet and a Crimson Moon! Catch Mercury if you can, then stay up late for a total lunar eclipse, and learn the truth about the dark side of the Moon. Skywatching Highlights All Month – Planets Visibility: Daily Highlights: March 7-9 – Catch Mercury: Look for Mercury beginning about 30 minutes after sunset […]
